title: How to Make Mustard Finger Chips

steps.headline: Wash the chipped potatoes and leave to drain on kitchen paper or a clean kitchen towel.
Combine all the items except potatoes and a small amount of oil into a blender.
steps.description: Add some water and make it into a smooth thick paste if required.

steps.headline: Put the chipped potatoes into a mixing bowl.
Pour the paste onto the potatoes along with the cornflour and mix well with a spoon or clean hands.
Leave the mixture for a few minutes.
Heat the oil to approximately 375 F in a heavy based pan and then carefully drop the potatoes into it.
steps.description: Be careful not to overload the frying pan with too many pieces, as the pieces will not get cooked.

steps.headline: Fry the chips for around 7-8 minutes with occasional tossing to cook them evenly.
Remove cooked chips from the oil.
Place the cooked chips onto kitchen paper to absorb any excess cooking oil.
Serve with the sauce of your choice, for instance tomato sauce or mayonnaise.

text: Wash the chipped potatoes and leave to drain on kitchen paper or a clean kitchen towel.  Combine all the items except potatoes and a small amount of oil into a blender. Add some water and make it into a smooth thick paste if required. Put the chipped potatoes into a mixing bowl.  Pour the paste onto the potatoes along with the cornflour and mix well with a spoon or clean hands.  Leave the mixture for a few minutes.  Heat the oil to approximately 375 F in a heavy based pan and then carefully drop the potatoes into it. Be careful not to overload the frying pan with too many pieces, as the pieces will not get cooked. Fry the chips for around 7-8 minutes with occasional tossing to cook them evenly.  Remove cooked chips from the oil.  Place the cooked chips onto kitchen paper to absorb any excess cooking oil.  Serve with the sauce of your choice, for instance tomato sauce or mayonnaise.
